citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
Protocols 201800039 and 16-007 are approved by the IACUC but have insufficient rationale for the appropriateness of the
number of animals used.
Protocol 201800039 refers only to how many animals have been used historically by the principal investigator to
determine how many macaques will be used for this animal activity. The Amendment Summary (AMEND202300036) from
said protocol states, under the “Justify the number of animals to be involved in this protocol” heading, “Our estimate is
fundamentally based on historic usage in our lab.”
Protocol 16-007 (experiments 6, 7, and 8 within this protocol) only list the number of animals used for each testing method
with no reference to how those numbers were determined.
The rationale/justification for the appropriateness of the numbers of animals used is vital to ensure an adequate
representation of the animal population to render useful research results, while also avoiding unnecessary overuse of the
selected animal species. The Intuitional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) must ensure any proposals to conduct
an activity involving animals, or to make a significant change in an ongoing activity involving animals, must contain a
rationale for involving animals, and for the appropriateness of the species and numbers of animals to be used.
Correct by: April 5, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
MARGARET SHAVER, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section
